    • Method Detail

      • onCreate

        public void onCreate(android.database.sqlite.SQLiteDatabase db)
        Called automatically when a database is being accessed while database does not exist. Takes a SQLiteDatabase to represent the Phone-side database class to write with. Creates a new empty database for user.
        Specified by:
        onCreate in class android.database.sqlite.SQLiteOpenHelper
        Parameters:
        db - The SQLiteDatabase to be constructed. Has no meaningful purpose since there is only ever one database

      • onUpgrade

        public void onUpgrade(android.database.sqlite.SQLiteDatabase db,
                      int oldVersion,
                      int newVersion)
        precondition: database was changed, we are upgrading to a new database. postcondition: new database created, all existing data lost. here we could do specific logic to transfer data from old database to new database.
        Specified by:
        onUpgrade in class android.database.sqlite.SQLiteOpenHelper
        Parameters:
        db - the phone database used to hold table
        oldVersion - the old version the database exists at
        newVersion - the new version to update the database to

      • getCalendarEvents

        public java.util.List<CalendarEvent> getCalendarEvents(java.lang.Long start,
                                                       java.lang.Long end)
        Get the events in the databse between two arbitrary start and end times. precondition: database already instantiated. postcondition: if readable database was not accessible, it is now accessible.
        Parameters:
        start - The start time to search
        end - The end time to search
        Returns:
        List of events that exist between these two times. null if error in db request.

      • getCalendarEvent

        public CalendarEvent getCalendarEvent(java.lang.Long id)
        Get the calendar event with the specified id precondition: database already instantiated. postcondition: if readable database was not accessible, it is now accessible.
        Parameters:
        id - The identifier to query the event
        Returns:
        Event containing informaton of event id. null if database query failed or no matching row

      • updateEvent

        public boolean updateEvent(CalendarEvent event)
        Edit an event.
        Parameters:
        event - The event to edit
        Returns:
        True if Details were added successfully, False if Details adding failed (possibly table corrupted)

      • addEvent

        public boolean addEvent(CalendarEvent event)
        Adds a new event.
        Parameters:
        event - The event to store in the database.
        Returns:
        True if Details were added successfully, False if Details adding failed (possibly table corrupted)

      • deleteEvent

        public boolean deleteEvent(CalendarEvent event)
        Delete an event based on information provided.
        Parameters:
        event - The event to store in the database. "getID()" must be non-null.
        Returns:
        True if events was removed, False if event removing failed (possibly table corrupted)

      • onDowngrade

        public void onDowngrade(android.database.sqlite.SQLiteDatabase db,
                        int oldVersion,
                        int newVersion)
        Handle db version changes. precondition: user reverting to old database version. postcondition: new database created, all existing data lost.
        Overrides:
        onDowngrade in class android.database.sqlite.SQLiteOpenHelper
        Parameters:
        db - the database physically on the phone associated with this application
        oldVersion - the previous database version integer
        newVersion - the new version integer to update the database to
